result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rosa Isela Sanchez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rosa Isela Sanchez in court in person, out of custody.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court in person for Rosa Isela Sanchez.  Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court in person on behalf of Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen for State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a DPA. Defendant unwilling to plea to the terms specified by the State within the agreement. Court is unable to accept a Plea. Court orders the matter to be set for a Jury Trial. Matter is adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for March 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Filed, but not accepted by the Court.
MEMORANDUM ON PLEA, Received and Filed

Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court with Rosa Isela Sanchez.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State has complied with victim notifiction.

Matter in court for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement, however defense has not received the paperwork.  Parties continue to negotiate.  State has submitted an offer.  Defense is waiting for an amended information be filed.  The defendant wishes to review the paperwork with her immigration attorney and get their opinion.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 6. Case set for Status Conference.  Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 6.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Notice of Completion of Representation, received and filed.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rosa Isela Sanchez in court with attorneys Matt Last and Justin L. Singleton.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. State is in compliance with victim/witness laws. Stipulation for substitution of counsel was filed and addressed by the Court. Court grants stipulation to have Justin Singleton represent the defendant. Defense is in receipt of discovery and is awaiting to receive videos from the state. Defense requests a status date. State objects and requests a jury trial date. Court grants defense's requests to allow one more status. Defendant's appearance is waived for the next scheduled status conference ONLY. If case is not in resolution posture, case to be set for trial at the next court date.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04E (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Stipulation for Change of Counsel, filed.

Defendant Rosa Isela Sanchez in court with attorney Matt Last.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Defense has received discovery, awaiting additional digital discovery.  Case adjourned to branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rosa Isela Sanchez in court with Attorney Matt Last; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Gleesing.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and Filed. ORDER GRANTING SUBSTITUTION OF COUNSEL

Defendant Rosa Isela Sanchez in court with Attorney Matt Last.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on vacation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; ORDER GRANTING SUBSTITUTION OF COUNSEL
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Stipulation for Substitution of Attorneys

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (3-25-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MGS and JNS.

Defendant Rosa Isela Sanchez in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
Defense challenges probable cause. Arguments heard. 
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 028435,
Payable Number: 994715,
Receipt Number: 22RP011907,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/23/22 @ 1:30p
